thread.title: Eastenders viewers left divided over Mick and Whitney Carter’s growing relationship as the pair move in together
thread.title_full: Eastenders viewers left divided over Mick and Whitney Carter’s growing relationship as the pair move in together

author: tpearce
title: Eastenders viewers left divided over Mick and Whitney Carter’s growing relationship as the pair move in together
text:
When Whitney discovered Mick had got back her deposit, she fumed: “I thought we were supposed to be family, Lee’s gone out the door five minutes and you’re trying to get rid of me.” 
She then angrily throws her wedding and engagement rings at him. Jonathan Cheban dates Kim Kardashian's waxwork body double on Celebs Go Dating but doesn't even notice LABOUR OF LOVE Here's what you need to know about Love Island 2017 'GENUINELY OVERWHELMED' Emmerdale's Danny Miller shares his delight as viewers praise 'Robron' wedding scenes 'SPIT VODKA IN MY MOUTH' Lewis Bloor cheats on Marnie Simpson on VALENTINE'S DAY with girl he met at a cab rank HEATING UP? EastEnders' Mick Carter asks daughter-in-law Whitney to move in with him after marriage split with Lee 'I was literally half myself' Ant Middleton reveals stunning 46lb weight loss while filming new show Mutiny ROBRON IS OFFICIAL Emmerdale's Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden finally tie the knot - but pair are cruelly separated by jail 'THANK YOU' David Cassidy tweets thanks to fans for love and support after revealing he has dementia 'BABA ON THE WAY!' Chelsee Healey shows off her growing baby bump in glamorous Twitter picture Whitney and Mick are so gonna hook up and UGH WHY WHY WHY #eastenders 
She continued: “Lee tried to be like you and after today I’m starting to think you two are exactly the same after all.” 
Once she calmed down, Mick revealed his actual plans. 
He says: “What did you think I was gonna do? Turf ya out the gaff? Not known refer to copyright holder 
“I assumed you were gonna come and live with us cos you’re a Carter now. Now Lee might have turned his back on ya, but we ain’t.” 
Whitney agrees to “think about it” before the two confirm that they are “sweet” with each other. 
The pair’s growing closer has not gone unnoticed. Errr Whitney going to live with Mick is a bad idea #eastenders 
— Lori ✨♛ (@lori4evaa) February 21, 2017 
The Queen Vic landlord – who is played by actor Danny Dyer – has become embroiled in a flirtatious relationship with his son’s ex and after two kisses and the absence of his actual wife Linda, it looks like they’re only going to grow closer. 
With Mick facing financial ruin over the leaking Vic roof, his £20,000 fine courtesy of Aunt Babe and the pressures of clearing his son Lee’s debts and the growing cost of funding his mother-in-law’s care in Spain, when he receives yet more bad news, he turns to Whitney for help. mum Shirley isn’t impressed. BBC Press Handout 4 
However with the soap in chaos due to actor Danny Dyer’s forced break, scripts are having to be re-written which means the show could go anywhere. EastEnders airs Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday nights on BBC One Got a story? email or call us direct on 02077824220
